by
May 22, 2025
Source: YouTube

"You think we're just going let you steal our fans? You're gonna have to fight us for that!" Netflix revealed the full official trailer for the long-awaited KPop Demon Hunters animated movie, finally releasing on Netflix in June. "MIRA! RUMI! ZOEY!" KPop Demon Hunters are ready to take the stage. This project has been in the works for the last 4 years, originally in development in 2021 at Sony Pictures Animation. When they aren't selling out stadiums, Kpop superstars Rumi, Mira and Zoey use their secret identities as badass demon hunters to protect all their fans from an ever-present supernatural threat. Together, they must face their biggest enemy yet – an irresistible rival boy band of demons in disguise. Starring the voices of Arden Cho, Ahn Hyo-seop, May Hong, Ji-young Yoo, Yunjin Kim, Joel Kim Booster, Liza Koshy, with Daniel Dae Kim, Ken Jeong, and Byung Hun Lee. And with original songs performed by EJAE, Audrey Nuna, REI AMI, Andrew Choi, Danny Chung, Kevin Woo, samUIL Lee, Neckwav, Lea Salonga; along with a special song by Jeongyeon, Jihyo and Chaeyoung of TWICE. This looks like glamorous & fancy musical fun.

Here's the full trailer (+ poster) for Kang & Appelhans's animation KPop Demon Hunters, via YouTube:

When they aren't selling out stadiums, Kpop superstars Rumi, Mira, and Zoey (Arden Cho, May Hong, Ji-young Yoo) use their secret identities as badass demon hunters to protect their fans from an ever-present supernatural threat. Together, they must face their biggest enemy yet – an irresistible rival boy band of demons in disguise. KPop Demon Hunters is co-directed by filmmakers Maggie Kang (story artist on The Grinch and Minions: The Rise of Gru) & Chris Appelhans (director of Wish Dragon previously), directing their first feature film together after working on many projects. The screenplay is by Danya Jimenez & Hannah McMechan and Maggie Kang and Chris Appelhans; from a story by Maggie Kang. Produced by Michelle L.M. Wong. Made by Sony Pictures Imageworks. With an original score by Marcelo Zarvos. Netflix releases KPop Demon Hunters streaming on Netflix worldwide starting on June 20th, 2025 this summer.
